qas.question: When did America's market for salt disappear?

context: The war had removed Bermuda's primary trading partners, the <a0_0>American colonies<a0_0/>, from the empire, and dealt a harsh blow to Bermuda's merchant shipping trade. This also suffered due to the <a1_0>deforestation<a1_0/> of Bermuda, as well as the advent of metal ships and steam propulsion, for which <a2_0>it did not have raw materials<a2_0/>. <b7_0>During the course of the following War of 1812<b7_0/>, the primary market for Bermuda's <b4_0>salt<b4_0/> disappeared as the <a3_0>Americans developed their own sources<a3_0/>. <b6_0>Control of <b5_0>the Turks<b5_0/> had passed to the Bahamas<b6_0/> in 1819.
